result.markdown: --- format: html: toc: true toc-title: On this page toc-depth: 4 # default is 3 number-sections: false anchor-sections: true smooth-scroll: true css: ../style.css --- ::: {.cell} ::: # Network Analysis ##### Calculate emprical regularized [correlation](#correlation), [biochemical](#biochemical) relationships and [structural similarity](#structural) networks. Each module supports rich `static`, `interactive` and `dynamic` network [visualizations](#visualize). ### [Translate]{.txbox_green} ##### Translate between > 200 bichemical identifiers. #### [Calculate]{.txbox_gray} ::::: columns ::: column ##### Select translation options. The `identifier` selects the column in the `col_meta` to translate. Use `from` and `to` to specify the identify of the selected `identifier` and what new `identifier` it should be translated to. ::: ::: column ![](img/dave.network/translate/methods.png){.bordered} ::: ::: ::::: columns ::: column ##### View translation results. ::: ::: column ![](img/dave.network/translate/results.png){.bordered} ::: ::: ### [Mapping]{.txbox_green} ##### Combine and create variable mappings to add to network visualization node and edge properties. #### [Calculate]{.txbox_gray} ::::: columns ::: column ##### Map the log base 2 transformed `fold-change` to its absolute value and sign. This is useful to normalize increases and decreases and encode their magnitude and direction of change using separate asthetics. ::: ::: column ![](img/dave.network/mapping/methods.png){.bordered} ::: ::: ::::: columns ::: column ##### Map the significance of a `p-value` to a binary (e.g. true or false) outcome. This is useful to separate asthetics for significant and non-significant `fold-changes`. The following examples would evaluate if the `p-value` is less than or equal to `0.05`. ::: ::: column ![](img/dave.network/mapping/methods_p.png){.bordered} ::: ::: ::::: columns ::: column ##### Combine mapped variables. This is useful to fine-tune asthetics based on custom combinations of mappings. ::: ::: column ![](img/dave.network/mapping/methods_combine.png){.bordered} ::: ::: ::::: columns ::: column ##### View the results of the mapping process. Note you first need to `save` the results from `fold-change` and `p-values` prior to using them with the `combine` transformation. ::: ::: column ![](img/dave.network/mapping/results.png){.bordered} ::: ::: ### [Correlation]{.txbox_green} ##### This module is used to create and `regularized` `correlation` networks @huge. #### [Calculate]{.txbox_gray} ::::: columns ::: column ##### Select correlation type and if `p-values` should be `False discovery rate` @p_adjust_BH corrected. ::: ::: column ![](img/dave.network/corrmap/corr_methods.png){.bordered} ::: ::: ::::: columns ::: column ##### Select regularizationm method based on rotation information criterion (ric), stability approach to regularization selection (stars) or extended Bayesian information criterion (ebic) @huge. Note you can also manually select the regularization `lambda` (higher lambda is more strict), but this needs to be done after a model is calculated. If no edges are returned using `manual` then try a lowe or less stict regularization. ::: ::: column ![](img/dave.network/corrmap/reg_methods.png){.bordered} ::: ::: ::::: columns ::: column ##### View methods and summary for the calculated network. ::: ::: column ![](img/dave.network/corrmap/results.png){.bordered} ::: ::: ### [Biochemical]{.txbox_green} ##### This module is used to calculate and `biochemcial` networks. Metabolomic precursor to product relationships are based on `KEGG` identifiers. #### [Calculate]{.txbox_gray} ::::: columns ::: column ##### Select [KEGG](https://www.genome.jp/kegg/) identifier column name in the data. ::: ::: column ![](img/dave.network/keggmap/methods.png){.bordered} ::: ::: ::::: columns ::: column ##### View methods and summary for the calculated network. ::: ::: column ![](img/dave.network/keggmap/results.png){.bordered} ::: ::: ### [Structural]{.txbox_green} ##### This module is used to calculate and `structural` simialrity networks. Metabolite `structural` similarities are calculated based on overlap in Pubchem structural fingerprints defined by `compound identifiers` or [`CID`](https://pubchem.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/) #### [Calculate]{.txbox_gray} ::::: columns ::: column ##### Select Pubchem [CID](https://pubchem.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/search/help_search.html) identifier column name in the data. ::: ::: column ![](img/dave.network/chemmap/methods.png){.bordered} ::: ::: ::::: columns ::: column ##### View methods and summary for the calculated network. ::: ::: column ![](img/dave.network/chemmap/results.png){.bordered} ::: ::: ### [Enrich]{.txbox_green} ##### This module is used to combine and visualize networks. #### [Calculate]{.txbox_gray} ::::: columns ::: column ##### `Select` networks to combine and visualize. Use `single edges` to remove duplicate edges from the combined edge lists. ::: ::: column ![](img/dave.network/enrich/select_methods.png){.bordered} ::: ::: ::::: columns ::: column ##### `Update` network node attributes based on another compatible data set. ::: ::: column ![](img/dave.network/enrich/update_methods.png){.bordered} ::: ::: ::::: columns ::: column ##### View methods and summary for the calculated network. ::: ::: column ![](img/dave.network/enrich/results.png){.bordered} ::: ::: #### [Visualize]{.txbox_gray} ##### Visualize the created networks. Note the same visualization options are also available for the correlation, biochemical and structural modules. ::::: columns ::: column ##### Visualize and modify network node attributes. ::: ::: column ![](img/dave.network/visualize/nodes_ui.png){.bordered} ::: ::: ::::: columns ::: column ##### Modify and filter edges or relationships. Use this module to filter edges based on structural similarity (e.g. >0.8) or correlation strength. ::: ::: column ![](img/dave.network/visualize/edges_ui.png){.bordered} ::: ::: ::::: columns ::: column ##### Customize network global properties. ::: ::: column ![](img/dave.network/visualize/canvas_ui.png){.bordered} ::: ::: ::::: columns ::: column ##### Create `static` plots which will be featured in the report. ::: ::: column ![](img/dave.network/visualize/plot_static.png){.bordered} ::: ::: ::::: columns ::: column ##### Create `interactive` plots which allow pan zoom, on hover annotations and control of which nodes and edges are shown. ::: ::: column ![](img/dave.network/visualize/plot_interactive.png){.bordered} ::: ::: ::::: columns ::: column ##### Create `idynamic` plots which highlight node connections, on hover annotations, moving nodes and look up of nodes of interest. ::: ::: column ![](img/dave.network/visualize/plot_dynamic.png){.bordered} ::: :::
